Elevation

Grid, input

param.name: SINKROUTE
param.dialogReference:
Sink Routes

Grid, input, optional

optional

param.name: WEIGHTS
param.dialogReference:
Weights

Grid, input, optional

optional

param.name: FLOW
param.dialogReference:
Flow Accumulation

Grid, output

param.name: VAL_INPUT
param.dialogReference:
Input for Mean over Catchment

Grid, input, optional

optional

param.name: VAL_MEAN
param.dialogReference:
Mean over Catchment

Grid, output

param.name: ACCU_MATERIAL
param.dialogReference:
Material for Accumulation

Grid, input, optional

optional

param.name: ACCU_TARGET
param.dialogReference:
Accumulation Target

Grid, input

param.name: ACCU_TOTAL
param.dialogReference:
Accumulated Material

Grid, output, optional

optional

param.name: ACCU_LEFT
param.dialogReference:
Accumulated Material (Left Side)

Grid, output, optional

optional

param.name: ACCU_RIGHT
param.dialogReference:
Accumulated Material (Right Side)

Grid, output, optional

optional

param.name: STEP
param.dialogReference:
Step

Integer

Minimum: 1

Default: 1

For testing purposes. Only generate flow at cells with step distance (each step row/column).

param.name: FLOW_UNIT
param.dialogReference:
Flow Accumulation Unit

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] number of cells

[1] cell area

Default: 1

param.name: FLOW_LENGTH
param.dialogReference:
Flow Path Length

Grid, output, optional

optional

average distance that a cell's accumulated flow travelled

param.name: LINEAR_VAL
param.dialogReference:
Linear Flow Threshold Grid

Grid, input, optional

optional

optional grid providing values to be compared with linear flow threshold instead of flow accumulation

param.name: LINEAR_DIR
param.dialogReference:
Channel Direction

Grid, input, optional

optional

use this for (linear) flow routing, if the value is a valid direction (0-7 = N, NE, E, SE, S, SW, W, NW)

param.name: WEIGHT_LOSS
param.dialogReference:
Loss through Negative Weights

Grid, output, optional

optional

when using weights without support for negative flow: output of the absolute amount of negative flow that occurred

param.name: METHOD
param.dialogReference:
Method

Choice

Available Choices:

[0] Deterministic 8

[1] Rho 8

[2] Braunschweiger Reliefmodell

[3] Deterministic Infinity

[4] Multiple Flow Direction

[5] Multiple Triangular Flow Directon

[6] Multiple Maximum Downslope Gradient Based Flow Directon

Default: 4

param.name: LINEAR_DO
param.dialogReference:
Thresholded Linear Flow

Boolean

Default: 0

apply linear flow routing (D8) to all cells, having a flow accumulation greater than the specified threshold

param.name: LINEAR_MIN
param.dialogReference:
Linear Flow Threshold

Integer

Minimum: 0

Default: 500

flow accumulation threshold (cells) for linear flow routing

param.name: CONVERGENCE
param.dialogReference:
Convergence

Floating point

Minimum: 0.001000

Default: 1.100000

Convergence factor for Multiple Flow Direction Algorithm (Freeman 1991).

Applies also to the Multiple Triangular Flow Directon Algorithm.

param.name: MFD_CONTOUR
param.dialogReference:
Contour Length

Boolean

Default: 0

Include (pseudo) contour length as additional weighting factor in multiple flow direction routing, reduces flow to diagonal neighbour cells by a factor of 0.71 (s. Quinn et al. 1991 for details).

param.name: NO_NEGATIVES
param.dialogReference:
Prevent Negative Flow Accumulation

Boolean

Default: 1

when using weights: do not transport negative flow, set it to zero instead; useful e.g. when accumulating measures of water balance.

tool.summary:
Top-down processing of cells for calculation of flow accumulation and related parameters. This set of algorithms processes a DEM downwards from the highest to the lowest cell. Flow routing methods provided by this tool:
  • Deterministic 8 (aka D8, O'Callaghan & Mark 1984)
  • Braunschweiger Reliefmodell (Bauer et al. 1985)
  • Rho 8 (Fairfield & Leymarie 1991)
  • Multiple Flow Direction (Freeman 1991, Quinn et al. 1991)
  • Deterministic Infinity (Tarboton 1997)
  • Triangular Multiple Flow Direction (Seibert & McGlynn 2007
  • Multiple Flow Direction based on Maximum Downslope Gradient (Qin et al. 2011)
